summary: Introduction to LangSmith Observability for tracing application steps, enabling debugging, evaluation, and monitoring via runs and traces.

structure.title: LangSmith Observability
structure.summary: Introduction to LangSmith Observability for tracing application steps, enabling debugging, evaluation, and monitoring via runs and traces.

nodes.title: Prerequisites
nodes.summary: Requirements for using LangSmith Observability: a LangSmith account and an API key.

nodes.title: Enable tracing
nodes.summary: Instructions for enabling tracing in LangSmith by setting environment variables and configuring project names.

nodes.title: Trace selectively
nodes.summary: Explains how to selectively trace specific invocations in LangSmith using the `tracing_context` context manager to control tracing behavior.

nodes.path: observability > LangSmith Observability > Log to a project
nodes.title: Log to a project
nodes.summary: Explains how to set a project name for logging in LangSmith, both statically via environment variable and dynamically via Python context manager.

nodes.path: observability > LangSmith Observability > Add metadata to traces
nodes.title: Add metadata to traces
nodes.summary: Explains how to add custom metadata and tags to traces in LangSmith using agent.invoke config or ls.tracing_context for observability.

nodes.path: observability > LangSmith Observability > Use anonymizers to prevent logging of sensitive data in traces
nodes.title: Use anonymizers to prevent logging of sensitive data in traces
nodes.summary: Describes how to use anonymizers in LangSmith to mask sensitive data, such as Social Security Numbers, in traces to prevent logging.
